references/eClassifiers/Task/references/.title: callback
references/eClassifiers/Task/references/.content: Type Callback Multiplicity 0..1 Function to be executed after task completion.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: embedder
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Code Multiplicity 0..1 Configuration for the embedder to be used by the crew.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: stepCallback
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Callback Multiplicity 0..1 A function that is called after each step of every agent. This can be used to log the agent’s actions or to perform other operations; it won’t override the agent-specific step callback.

references/eClassifiers/Task/index.html.title: Task
references/eClassifiers/Task/index.html.content: A Task is a specific assignment completed by an Agent. Tasks provide all necessary details for execution, such as a description, the agent responsible, required tools, and more, facilitating a wide range of action complexities. Tasks can be collaborative, requiring multiple agents to work together.

references/eClassifiers/Code/references/.title: code
references/eClassifiers/Code/references/.content:
Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 How code attribute is used is subclass-specific: Crew - code is added to the top of the generated crew class after configuration fields and before any other declarations. Agent and Task - code is used as agent/task method body template. Function - code is used to produce function body. Tool - what is added to the tools array. E.g. SerperDevTool(). Code can contain interpolation tokens for adding imports. Example: my_var = ${spel:addItemImport('my_module', 'my_item').item}
 spel: is a prefix for Spring Expression Language tokens. addItemImport('my_module', 'my_item').item - calls org.nasdanika.models.python.Source.addImport() method and then getItem() value of the result. Import methods: addItemImport(module, item) - the method used above addItemImport(module, item, name) - in this case use .name addModuleImport(module) - in this case use add dot and imported item after the token. e.g. ${spel:addModuleImport('my_module').module}.my_item addModuleImport(module, alias) - in this case use add dot and imported item after the token. e.g. ${spel:addModuleImport('my_module', 'mi_modulo').alias}.my_item

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: afterKickoff
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Function Multiplicity 0..1 Executes after the crew finishes.

references/eClassifiers/Task/references/.title: taskDescription
references/eClassifiers/Task/references/.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 A clear, concise statement of what the task entails.

references/eClassifiers/Task/references/.title: tools
references/eClassifiers/Task/references/.content: Type Tool Multiplicity 0..* The tools/resources the agent is limited to use for this task.

references/eClassifiers/Guardrail/index..title: Guardrail
references/eClassifiers/Guardrail/index..content: Task guardrails provide a powerful way to validate, transform, or filter task outputs before they are passed to the next task. Guardrails are optional functions that execute before the next task starts, allowing you to ensure that task outputs meet specific requirements or formats.

references/eClassifiers/KnowledgeSource/.title: agents
references/eClassifiers/KnowledgeSource/.content: Type Agent Multiplicity 0..* Agents using this knowledge source.

references/eClassifiers/KnowledgeSource/.title: Knowledge Source
references/eClassifiers/KnowledgeSource/.content: Knowledge allows agents to access and utilize external information sources during their tasks. Think of it as giving your agents a reference library they can consult while working.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: functionCallingLlm
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Large Language Model Multiplicity 0..1 If passed, the crew will use this LLM to do function calling for tools for all agents in the crew. Each agent can have its own LLM, which overrides the crew’s LLM for function calling.

index.html.title: CrewAI Model

references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.title: role
references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Defines the agent’s function and expertise within the crew.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: agents
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Agent Multiplicity 0..* Agents in this crew.

references/eClassifiers/Agent/index.html.title: Agent
references/eClassifiers/Agent/index.html.content: An Agent is an autonomous unit that can: Perform specific tasks Make decisions based on its role and goal Use tools to accomplish objectives Communicate and collaborate with other agents Maintain memory of interactions Delegate tasks when allowed

references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.title: embedder
references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.content: Type Code Multiplicity 0..1 Configuration for the embedder used by the agent.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: taskCallback
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Callback Multiplicity 0..1 A function that is called after the completion of each task. Useful for monitoring or additional operations post-task execution.

references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.title: tasks
references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.content: Type Task Multiplicity 0..* Tasks assigned to this agent.

references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.title: backstory
references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Provides context and personality to the agent, enriching interactions.

references/eClassifiers/Function/referen.title: parameters
references/eClassifiers/Function/referen.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..* A list of function parameters.

references/eClassifiers/Task/references/.title: expectedOutput
references/eClassifiers/Task/references/.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 A detailed description of what the task’s completion looks like.

references/eClassifiers/Tool/references/.title: agents
references/eClassifiers/Tool/references/.content: Type Agent Multiplicity 0..* Agents using this tool.

references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.title: goal
references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 The individual objective that guides the agent’s decision-making.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: knowledgeSources
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Knowledge Source Multiplicity 0..* Knowledge sources used by agents

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: planningLlm
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Large Language Model Multiplicity 0..1 The language model used by the AgentPlanner in a planning process

references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.title: stepCallback
references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.content: Type Callback Multiplicity 0..1 Function called after each agent step, overrides crew callback.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: managerLlm
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Large Language Model Multiplicity 0..1 The language model used by the manager agent in a hierarchical process.

references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.title: llm
references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.content: Type Large Language Model Multiplicity 0..1 Language model that powers the agent.

references/eClassifiers/Tool/index.html.title: Tool
references/eClassifiers/Tool/index.html.content: A tool is a skill or function that agents can utilize to perform various actions.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: tasks
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Task Multiplicity 0..* Tasks containment reference.

references/eClassifiers/Configurable/ind.title: Configurable
references/eClassifiers/Configurable/ind.content: Base class for Agent and Task which can be configured with YAML.

references/eClassifiers/Configurable/ref.title: configMap
references/eClassifiers/Configurable/ref.content: Type EMap< EString, EJavaObject> Multiplicity 0..1 Configuration map computed from YAML configuration and other features.

references/eClassifiers/Process/index.ht.title: Process
references/eClassifiers/Process/index.ht.content: Processes enable individual agents to operate as a cohesive unit, streamlining their efforts to achieve common objectives with efficiency and coherence.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: managerAgent
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Agent Multiplicity 0..1 A custom agent managing the crew.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: tools
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Tool Multiplicity 0..* Tools containment reference.

references/eClassifiers/Code/references/.title: imports
references/eClassifiers/Code/references/.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Imports used by code can be specified as a list of maps or a single map with the keys corresponding to Import attributes.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/index.html.title: Crew
references/eClassifiers/Crew/index.html.content: A crew represents a collaborative group of agents working together to accomplish a set of tasks. Each crew defines the strategy for task execution, agent collaboration, and the overall workflow.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: languageModels
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Large Language Model Multiplicity 0..* Language models used by the crew and its agents

references/eClassifiers/Code/references/.title: comment
references/eClassifiers/Code/references/.content: Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Comment to add before the code.

references/eClassifiers/Callback/index.h.title: Callback
references/eClassifiers/Callback/index.h.content: Crew Step Callback - A function that is called after each step of every agent. Task Callback - A function that is called after the completion of each task. Useful for monitoring or additional operations post-task execution. Agent Step Callback - Function called after each agent step, overrides crew callback. Task Callback - Function/object to be executed after task completion.

references/eClassifiers/Tool/references/.title: declarations
references/eClassifiers/Tool/references/.content:
Type EString Multiplicity 0..1 Declarations used by the tool. Added to the crew class body. For example, a shared search tool can have the following declaration: serper_tool = SeperDevTool()
 In this case the tool code would be serper_tool

references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.title: knowledgeSources
references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.content: Type Knowledge Source Multiplicity 0..* Knowledge sources available to the agent.

references/eClassifiers/Task/references/.title: guardrail
references/eClassifiers/Task/references/.content: Type Guardrail Multiplicity 0..1 Task guardrails provide a way to validate and transform task outputs before they are passed to the next task. This feature helps ensure data quality and provides feedback to agents when their output doesn’t meet specific criteria.

references/eClassifiers/LargeLanguageMod.title: Large Language Model
references/eClassifiers/LargeLanguageMod.content: Large Language Models (LLMs) are the core intelligence behind agents. They enable agents to understand context, make decisions, and generate human-like responses.

references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.title: tools
references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.content: Type Tool Multiplicity 0..* Capabilities or functions available to the agent.

references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.title: functionCallingLlm
references/eClassifiers/Agent/references.content: Type Large Language Model Multiplicity 0..1 Language model for tool calling, overrides crew’s LLM if specified.

references/eClassifiers/Task/references/.title: agent
references/eClassifiers/Task/references/.content: Type Agent Multiplicity 0..1 The agent responsible for executing the task.

references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.title: beforeKickoff
references/eClassifiers/Crew/references/.content: Type Function Multiplicity 0..1 Executes before the crew starts.

references/eClassifiers/Tool/references/.title: tasks
references/eClassifiers/Tool/references/.content: Type Task Multiplicity 0..* Tasks using this tool.

references/eClassifiers/Code/index.html.title: Code
references/eClassifiers/Code/index.html.content: Base class for model element which generate python code.
